marketNews.title: China's National Statistics Bureau recorded that China's manufacturing PMI fell to 50.4 in April 2024 (vs. March 2024: 50.8), but was still higher than the consensus estimate of 50.3. This realization marked expansive manufacturing activity for 2 consecutive months.
marketNews.content: China's national statistics bureau recorded that the manufacturing PMI in China fell to the level of 50.4 in April 2024 (vs. March 2024: 50.8), but was still higher than the consensus expectation at the level of 50.3. This realization marks expansive manufacturing activity for 2 consecutive months.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Government Plans to Offer Dual Citizenship to Attract Overseas Workers
marketNews.content: Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, said that the Indonesian government plans to offer dual citizenship to people of Indonesian descent. This step is intended to bring skilled Indonesian people back to Indonesia. However, Luhut did not provide further details regarding this discourse. According to data from the Directorate General of Immigration, nearly 4,000 Indonesians became citizens of Singapore between 2019-2022.

marketNews.title: Traveloka Repays $300 Million Private Credit Facility
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that PT Traveloka Indonesia has repaid a credit facility worth 300 million US dollars to lenders, including BlackRock Inc. and Orion Capital Asia. Bloomberg sources said that Traveloka used its internal cash to repay the loan. The facility was obtained by Traveloka in 2022, with maturity in 2026. Traveloka reportedly only used 250 million US dollars of the credit facility.

tickerNews.title: ASII 1Q24: Resilient Performance Thanks to Diversification; Final Dividend of Rp421/Share Approved
tickerNews.content: Astra International ($ASII) recorded a net profit of 7.5 trillion rupiah (-14.4% YoY, -8.4% QoQ) in 1Q24, equivalent to 24.1% of the consensus FY24 estimate. Although appearing below expectations, the low net profit was also caused by the impairment of investment in Medikaloka Hermina ($HEAL) and GoTo Gojek Tokopedia ($GOTO). If the investment impairment is set aside, ASII's net profit in 1Q24 remained at a quite resilient level of 8.1 trillion rupiah, equivalent to 26.3% of the consensus FY24 estimate and in line with expectations. Based on segments, Automotive and United Tractors ($UNTR) suppressed ASII's performance, while Financial Services became the main support. Here is the detail: Automotive - Operating profit fell -45.8% YoY, although it improved quarterly. The decline in operating profit was caused by an increase in cost of sales (+4.7% YoY) and general and administrative expenses (+8.3% YoY), even though revenue remained relatively stable (+0% YoY, +17.6% QoQ). Management explained that the success in maintaining revenue - even though ASII's car sales volume dropped -20% YoY - was due to increased sales of cars with more premium selling prices, such as the Innova Zennix and Yaris Cross. UNTR - Operating profit fell -8.5% YoY and -22.6% QoQ, driven by weakness in the heavy equipment sales and coal mining segments. Meanwhile, the mining contractor segment recorded good performance and became the support for UNTR's performance. Financial Services - Operating profit grew +19.1% YoY and +5.0% QoQ, driven by strong consumer financing in the car, motorcycle, and heavy equipment segments. In addition to the Financial Services business, ASII's performance was also supported by the relatively solid performance of associated entities and joint ventures (JV). Net profit from associated entities and JVs still managed to grow to 2.6 trillion rupiah (+5.2% YoY, +16.0% QoQ), supported by an increase in the net profit of PT Astra Honda Motor to 2.4 trillion rupiah (+4.0% YoY). Key Takeaway: We assess ASII's performance in 1Q24 as quite good. Amidst sluggish automotive sales, ASII's net profit excluding impairment dropped only -5% YoY. The positive performance recorded by the Financial Services segment, Mining Contractors (under UNTR), and associated entities and JVs successfully supported ASII, which is a positive note. This 1Q24 performance demonstrates ASII's stability thanks to its diversified business. Furthermore, we also assess that various bad news has been reflected in ASII's stock price, so the risk of further downside appears limited. With a low valuation (7x 1-Year Forward P/E), we assess that ASII offers an attractive risk-reward. Additionally, at the GMS today, Tuesday (30/4), ASII shareholders also approved the payment of a final dividend of 421 rupiah per share, indicating a final dividend yield of 8.2%.

tickerNews.title: BUKA Recorded Positive Adjusted EBITDA for the First Time
tickerNews.content: $BUKA: Bukalapak recorded a net loss of 39 billion rupiah in 1Q24, a drastic decrease from the level in 1Q23 (loss of 1.0 trillion rupiah) and 4Q23 (loss of 593 billion rupiah). In 1Q24, adjusted EBITDA reached a positive level for the first time at 15 billion rupiah (1Q23: negative 209 billion rupiah; 4Q23: negative 46 billion rupiah), marking a new milestone for the company.

tickerNews.title: BNGA: CIMB Niaga Records Net Profit of 1.68 Trillion Rupiah in 1Q24, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: $BNGA: Bank CIMB Niaga recorded a net profit of 1.68 trillion rupiah (+6.9% QoQ, +6.3% YoY) in 1Q24, exceeding expectations by reaching 26.2% of the consensus FY24 estimate. Net Interest Income reached 3.2 trillion rupiah (+3.8% QoQ, -3.6% YoY), with provision expenses of 490 billion rupiah (+115% QoQ, -35% YoY). Operationally, disbursed credit grew +6% YoY, in line with management guidance of +5-7%, although below industry targets from BI and OJK (9-12%), with a Loan-to-Deposit Ratio recorded at 84.2% (vs. 1Q23: 82.2%; 4Q23: 89.3%). Meanwhile, Net Interest Margin decreased YoY to 4.2% (vs. 1Q23: 4.7%), but increased QoQ (vs. 4Q23: 4.0%).

tickerNews.title: PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Records Net Profit of 122 Billion Rupiah in 1Q24
tickerNews.content: $PANI: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua recorded a net profit of 122 billion rupiah (-32% YoY, 8x QoQ) in 1Q24. The annual decline in net profit was caused by a decrease in revenue (-30% YoY), while the significant quarterly profit increase was driven by a drastic decrease in operating expenses (-56% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: TPMA: Trans Power Marine Records Net Profit of US$5.7 Million in 1Q24
tickerNews.content: $TPMA: Trans Power Marine recorded a net profit of US$5.7 million (+17.2% YoY, -12.7% QoQ) in 1Q24, equivalent to 28.1% of the Stockbit FY24 estimate. Revenue decreased to US$16 million (-6.4% YoY, -13.8% QoQ), while the decrease in cost of revenue (-13.2% YoY, -13.9% QoQ) dropped more significantly, causing the gross profit margin to increase to 41.02% (vs. 1Q23: 36.4%, 4Q23: 40.95%). General and administrative expenses tended to be mixed (+6.2% YoY, -16.9% QoQ), so the operating profit margin rose to 33.3% (vs. 1Q23: 29.6%, 4Q23: 32.9%). The net profit growth was also supported by the contribution of net profit from the subsidiary entity, PT Trans Logistik Perkasa, which reached US$1.1 million (-3.3% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: MYOR: Mayora Indah Records Net Profit of 1.1 Trillion Rupiah in 1Q24
tickerNews.content: $MYOR: Mayora Indah recorded a net profit of 1.1 trillion rupiah (+52.9% YoY, -4.8% QoQ) in 1Q24, equivalent to 35% of the consensus FY24 estimate, with revenue of approximately 8.8 trillion rupiah (+3.7% YoY, +2.0% QoQ).

tickerNews.title: SSIA: Surya Semesta Internusa Announces BYD Will Occupy 108 Hectares Land in Subang Smartpolitan
tickerNews.content: $SSIA: Surya Semesta Internusa announced that the Chinese electric car manufacturer, Build Your Dreams (BYD), will occupy 108 hectares of land in Subang Smartpolitan with an undisclosed value. This transaction makes BYD the largest tenant in Subang Smartpolitan, with land handover targeted for August 2024. BYD itself plans to carry out phased factory construction operations and expects to start operating in January 2026.

tickerNews.title: HRUM: CEO Eyes Nickel Assets Acquisition Amidst Energy Transition Shift from Coal
tickerNews.content: $HRUM: Harum Energy President Director, Ray Antonio Gunara, said that the company is still targeting nickel mine acquisitions in preparation for the energy transition. Ray also mentioned that HRUM is considering an IPO plan for one of its nickel business units if market conditions improve. HRUM has acquired 3 nickel smelters and targets the nickel segment to contribute half of the total revenue in 2024, up from 10% in 2023. Additionally, Ray stated that HRUM plans to comply with the US Inflation Reduction Act regulations to gain access to Western markets.

tickerNews.title: AKRA: AKR Corporindo to Distribute Final Dividend for 2023 Financial Year of Rp50/Share
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo ($AKRA) will distribute a final dividend for the 2023 financial year amounting to 50 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation markets is May 8, 2024, while the payment date is May 27, 2024. Referring to the AKRA stock price on Tuesday (30/4) at 1,675 rupiah per share, the indicative final dividend yield is 2.9%. Previously, AKRA distributed an interim dividend of 50 rupiah per share in August 2023 and an interim dividend of 25 rupiah per share in November 2023.

tickerNews.title: SMSM: Selamat Sempurna to Distribute Interim Dividend of IDR 143.96 Billion or IDR 25/Share
tickerNews.content: Selamat Sempurna ($SMSM) will distribute an interim dividend of 143.96 billion rupiah or 25 rupiah per share. The cum-dividend date in the regular and negotiation markets is May 8, 2024, while the payment date is May 28, 2024. Referring to SMSM's stock price at the market close on Tuesday (30/4) at 1,800 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 1.4%. Previously, SMSM distributed the 2023 fiscal year interim dividend 3 times, namely 30 rupiah per share in November 2023, 25 rupiah per share in August 2023, and 25 rupiah per share in May 2023.
